context: In the early 1980s, Chicago radio jocks <a0_0><b5_0>The Hot Mix 5<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and club DJs Ron Hardy and Frankie Knuckles played various styles of dance music, including older disco records (mostly Philly disco and Salsoul tracks), <a2_0><b7_0>electro funk<b7_0/><a2_0/> tracks by artists such as Afrika Bambaataa, newer Italo disco, <a1_0><b6_0>B-Boy hip hop music<b6_0/><a1_0/> by Man Parrish, Jellybean Benitez, Arthur Baker, and John Robie, and <a3_0><b9_0>electronic pop music<b9_0/><a3_0/> by Kraftwerk and Yellow Magic Orchestra. Some made and played their own edits of their favorite songs on <a4_0><b8_0>reel-to-reel tape<b8_0/><a4_0/>, and sometimes mixed in effects, drum machines, and other rhythmic electronic instrumentation.
